Note: Participant states reels are very visible in the car setting. It’s better when we are driving in a shady area. If she looks straight ahead it’s very translucent and hard to see, where’s if she looks down she can see.
She states the experience is like normal sunglasses in that there is a glare from the sun. If she had her own choice she would look at the reels on her phone because its easier to see.
States that overall there are no tasks so far that she would have preferred to do on the glasses, she would prefer to do things on her phone.
Participant states reels lost connection for a minute but then reconnected.
Participant likes to zoom in and out on Maps, but finds it frustrating that she cannot do that in the glasses display.
She is unable to zoom out, see the crossroads, and look at specific streets. She states she can zoom out but can’t move out.
Stopped to take lux measurements. Hood: 66390, 66220, 66260. Dashboard: 32180, 32530, 32470. Passenger seat: 23510, 25860. Passenger window: 39790, 39730, 40380.
Participant states she was not able to scroll to the next reel because it would not load. Participant toggled glasses off and on and then opened Instagram again. Instagram did load at that point.
Participant states it was “a little bit better” in terms of seeing the display on the second half of the ride because it wasn’t as bright. Earlier in the ride the sun was “spot on”.
